articles.author: REESE DUNKLIN, RYAN J. FOLEY, JEFF MARTIN, JENNIFER McDERMOTT, HOLBROOK MOHR and JOHN SEEWER
articles.description: Carl Grant, a Vietnam veteran with dementia, wandered out of a hospital room to charge a cellphone he imagined he had. When he wouldn’t sit still, the police officer escorting Grant body-slammed him, ricocheting the patient’s head off the floor.
articles.title: Why did more than 1,000 people die after police subdued them with force that isn't meant to kill?

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza (AP) — An international team of doctors visiting a hospital in central Gaza was prepared for the worst. But the gruesome impact Israel’s war against Hamas is having on Palestinian children still left them stunned.
articles.title: Doctors visiting a Gaza hospital are stunned by the war's toll on Palestinian children

articles.author: LEA SKENE and BRIAN WITTE
articles.description: BALTIMORE (AP) — The cargo ship that lost power and crashed into a bridge in Baltimore underwent “routine engine maintenance” in port beforehand, the U.S. Coast Guard said Wednesday, as divers recovered the bodies of two of six workers who plunged into the water when it collapsed.
articles.title: Cargo ship had engine maintenance in port before it collided with Baltimore bridge, officials say

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN and COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A fundraiser for President Joe Biden on Thursday in New York City that also stars Barack Obama and Bill Clinton is raising a whopping $25 million — setting a new record for the most-ever haul for a single political event, his campaign said.
articles.title: Biden fundraiser in NYC with Obama, Clinton nets a whopping $25M, campaign says. It's a new record

articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The charges against former President Donald Trump in the Georgia election interference case seek to criminalize political speech and advocacy conduct that the First Amendment protects, his lawyers argued in a court filing challenging the indictment.
articles.title: Judge forges ahead with pretrial motions in Georgia election interference case

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — As Yemen’s Houthi rebels continue to target ships in a Mideast waterway, satellite pictures analyzed by The Associated Press show what appears to be a new airstrip being built at an entrance to that crucial maritime route.
articles.title: An airstrip is being built on a Yemeni island during the ongoing war, with 'I LOVE UAE' next to it

articles.author: SUSAN HAIGH
articles.description: HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) — Former U.S. Sen. Joe Lieberman of Connecticut, who nearly won the vice presidency on the Democratic ticket with Al Gore in the disputed 2000 election and who almost became Republican John McCain's running mate eight years later, has died, according to a statement issued by his family.
articles.title: Former Sen. Joe Lieberman, Democrats’ VP pick in 2000, dead at 82

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: For Evan Gershkovich, the dozen appearances in Moscow's courts over the past year have fallen into a pattern.
articles.title: US journalist marks a year in a Russian prison as courts keep extending his time behind bars

articles.author: FRANCIS KOKUTSE and JESSSICA DONATI
articles.description: ACCRA, Ghana (AP) — Shoppers may get a bitter surprise in their Easter baskets this year. Chocolate eggs and bunnies are more expensive than ever as changing climate patterns eat into global cocoa supplies and the earnings of farmers in West Africa.
articles.title: It's a bittersweet Easter for chocolate lovers and African cocoa farmers but big brands see profits

articles.author: COLLEEN BARRY
articles.description: FLORENCE, Italy (AP) — Michelangelo’s David has been a towering figure in Italian culture since its completion in 1504. But in the current era of the quick buck, curators worry the marble statue’s religious and political significance is being diminished by the thousands of refrigerator magnets and other souvenirs sold around Florence focusing on David’s genitalia.
articles.title: A fight to protect the dignity of Michelangelo's David raises questions about freedom of expression
